question.title: What is correct way to use Hibernate, generate tables using entity or generate tables using db sql file
question.body:
I am working on the application which have 10-15 tables and I will using Hibernate for database access. Now the question I have is, how to create a database for such application? Should I let hibernate crate database by defining the entities or keep control of database with me by using schema.sql and data.sql.

If I let hibernate create tables, it always causes issues in future if database design changes. That is why I am inclined to use schema.sql and data.sql.

I mean, is there any best practice? How to approach the design of the application, from database view or Java object view?

I read lot of questions on stackoverflow but there is no clean answer for the question. I am looking for any link or topic where it is discussed.

I know both the way will work fine. I have found some comments which says the relation is DB is not necessay if you are using hibernate like https://stackoverflow.com/a/37925244/20688290 and https://stackoverflow.com/a/5204600/20688290 which says there is no need to maintain any relation in DB if using Hibernate.
